title: Teen suspect killed in Shreveport armed robbery identified
content:
SHREVEPORT, La -
The Caddo Parish Coroner's office has identified the suspect shot and killed outside a local convenience store as a Shreveport teenager.
Through information gained from his personal property, he was identified as Grandson Johnson, 16, and his identity was confirmed by family members contacted by Shreveport police.
The incident remains under investigation by the Shreveport Police Department, but authorities say two people approached someone in a vehicle about 11:40pm Saturday at the Circle K in the 300 block of Kings Highway.
Police say one of them pulled a gun on a male passenger who was inside the vehicle and demanded the passenger's cell phone and ordered him to get out of the vehicle.
That's when things took a turn. Officials say the victim got out of the vehicle and pulled his own gun on the suspects and began firing, striking both suspects.
Johnson was killed and the other suspect was struck in the abdomen. The suspect who survived was taken to University Health for treatment.
